thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Tencent’s Shares Were On Fire. Now They Aren’t, and Analysts Are Getting Worried

author: Steven Russolillo
title: Tencent’s Shares Were On Fire. Now They Aren’t, and Analysts Are Getting Worried
text:
Asian markets were broadly lower on Wednesday, following declines in the U.S. that snapped a four-day rally. North Korea suspended high-level talks with Seoul, putting into question the planned U.S.-North Korea summit expected to take place next month. But South Korea’s main benchmark, the Kospi index, was little changed on the news. Elsewhere in regional markets, Chinese and Hong Kong stocks fell. The 10-year treasury yield jumped to 3.07%, its highest since 2011, as the U.S. dollar hovers near its 2018 highs.
